title: Fontoid by Barry Deck?
content:
Hi All,

In my quest to research so-called [Computer-style fonts like Data 70](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011041318/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35550), I came across this interesting interview between [Ellen Lupton and Jonathan Hoefler](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011041318/http:/www.elupton.com/index.php?id=22). In it, Hoefler mentions a typeface Barry Deck created for Nickelodeon called “Fontoid.”

Try as I might, I haven’t been able to find a sample of this anywhere, and I’d very much like to compare it with the other faces I’m looking at.

Does anyone have a sample or know where I can find one?

Thanks.

author: zachwhalen

comments.content:
It’s probably a proprietary face. I don’t think Barry Deck has font samples on [his website](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011041318/http:/www.barrydeck.com/index.html), but you could try to contact him.

Luc Devroye mentions Fontoid on [his site](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011041318/http:/cg.scs.carleton.ca/~luc/commercialfonts2.html), and says that Barry Deck sells it, but there are no links.

Other than Emigre and Village, I don’t know if any other foundries distribute his work.
I’ve sent an email inquiry to the contact address on barrydeck.com. The site doesn’t look like it’s been updated in a while, so I’ll have to hope I get a response.

“it’s time to fix the stuff he used to rail against”...

I couldn’t give a monkey’s, but it might as well read: “yes i’ve sold out, please use my anti-system style to make your brand slip earnestly into mainstream consciousness as if we’re one of -you-“

Hi zachwhalen.  
I have Fontoid, and some other old faces by Barry.  
I could try to make you a protected PDF; but I’m not sure if Barry would agree about that,.

I have not been in touch with him for a long time, so maybe (alternatively), we could try to contact him, or — if it’s the same thing to you – I could arrange a low-res bitmap image.  
I don’t know, however, if this could prove useful for your research, since Fontoid is pretty distant from the geometry found in Data70 et al.
